Embedded_text: Thank you to Arkansans who participated. More than 23,600 pounds of unneeded prescription medications were collected at locations across the state.

We’re working to secure investments in Arkansas. I'm pleased the Senate advanced legislation to support our state’s priorities and ensure our country lives up to the promises we made to veterans with improved resources for services and benefits.

As a member of the Congressional Coalition on Adoption I'm pleased to join the governor in celebrating National Adoption Month. I'm grateful for the tremendous work of organizations across Arkansas to find loving and permanent homes for children in our state.

Lake Hamilton senior Sarah Humphries has a national platform to share her enthusiasm for computer science with her fellow peers. We are proud of her work inspiring young women to pursue careers in this field.

Food security is national security. The United States must continue to be a leader in addressing hunger worldwide. I’m pleased to join my colleagues in championing the Foundation for International Food Security Act to create a new way to solve this crisis.

Military service is a family affair. There is a lot asked of loved ones of who serve alongside those who wear the uniform. November is recognized as National Military Family Month. Join me in celebrating unsung heroes of our military. Thank you for your commitment and sacrifice.
